clues.text: Her poem no. 1732 says, "Parting is all we know of heaven, and all we need of hell"
"All hell broke loose" comes from this 17th century epic poem
Revelation sayeth, "Behold" this beast: "and his name that sat on him was Death, and hell followed"
This play by Jean-Paul Sartre says it outright: "Hell is other people"
In "The American Crisis" he wrote, "Tyranny, like hell, is not easily conquered"
In the late '20s Harvey Cushing shocked the medical world by cutting out a tumor using this type of energy
Surgery may be needed for a case of hydrocephalus, aka this "on the brain"
Gelfoam & Avitene are this type of agent that helps curb blood flow if Doc zigs with the scalpel when he should've zagged
Surgery in which you don't need to cut is called this, as with the gamma knife & its focused beam of radiation
It's a swelling in a blood vessel; the cerebral type is a common cause of strokes

The Peloponnesian War:
Athens vs. ____

Punic Wars:
Rome vs. ____

War of the Roses:
____ vs. York

Crimean War:
France, Britain & ____ vs. Russia

The Peninsular War:
France vs. Britain, ____ & ____
Capulet is a family in "Romeo and Juliet"; an epaulet is an adornment worn on this part of the body
Biceps & triceps are muscles; this is a grasping instrument used by surgeons & dentists
Venezuela is a South American country; he's the lefty from Mexico who pitched for the Dodgers in the 1980s
While arugula is a bitterish salad green, rugelach are Jewish these
The Baltic Sea is an arm of the Atlantic; he's the French author sculpted head to toe by Rodin
In 1975 Lt. Col. Henry Blake was discharged from the army, then from life in a plane crash on this show
Chuckles the Clown, dressed for a parade as Peter Peanut, was shelled to death by an elephant on this '70s sitcom
In 1980 America's beloved dingbat, this character played by Jean Stapleton, was felled by a stroke
Brendan Fraser didn't get a chance to check out of Sacred Heart Hospital as Dr. Cox' brother-in-law on this show
Tracey Gold's older boyfriend (played by Matthew Perry!) paid the price for drunk driving on this '80s sitcom
Code name Valkyrie, the July plot was a 1944 attempt to assassinate this man
The gunpowder in the 1605 gunpowder plot was found under this building
A certain agency whose initials are C.I.A. helped plot the overthrow of this country's PM Mossadegh in 1953
Khrushchev said in 1956 that this leader had created the trumped-up "Doctors' Plot"
Yui Shosetsu failed in 1651 to oust the Tokugawa shogunate with an army of these "masterless warriors"
"Lara's Theme" can be heard in this epic film directed by David Lean
"I See You", the theme song for this movie, is a formal Na'vi greeting
The theme for this 2008 movie is "Bella's Lullaby"
The theme for this Tom Hanks movie is sometimes referred to as "The Feather Theme"
Rod McKuen wrote & sang "Jean", the theme song of this 1969 Maggie Smith film
A VHS or beta tape container
The only U.S. state that fits the bill
Yet to be populated, or ill at ease
At Belmont, the horse running in the front
A liqueur that tastes like licorice
One of this N. California city's many characters was Joshua Norton, who proclaimed himself U.S. emperor in 1859
Naturalist Charles Waterton lay for months with one foot dangling out of his hammock so this type of bat would bite him
Selling these starting in 1934, Madman Muntz basically invented the crazy pitchman shtick
Parking garage magnate Abraham Hirschfeld ran for several offices, always using this Lincolnesque nickname
In giving his compositions these numbers, Erik Satie started with 62 instead of 1

clues.text: This author took 8 years to write "Jurassic Park"
She took 10 years to write "Gone with the Wind"
Mon dieu! Victor Hugo began writing this sprawling epic in 1845 & finished it 17 years later
After years writing children's books, Gregory Maguire published this 1995 novel that revises a kids' classic
Herman Hesse took 11 years to pen this novel about an Indian boy during the time of Buddha
"Howbeit the hair of his head began to grow again after he was shaven"
2 guys: one was "a tiller of the ground" & his brother was "a keeper of sheep"
"In those days came" this man, "preaching in the wilderness of Judaea"
"And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that" he "opened the window...which he had made"
"Jesus saith unto him... because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed"

rounds.text: Family who lived by the motto "Life is on the wire.  The rest is just waiting."
